name: ory-hydra
description: OpenID Certified OAuth 2.0 Server and OpenID Connect Provider

repo.name: hydra
repo.description: Internet-scale OpenID Certified™ OpenID Connect and OAuth2.1 provider that integrates with your user management through headless APIs. Solve OIDC/OAuth2 user cases over night. Consume as a service on Ory Network or self-host. Trusted by OpenAI and many others for scale and security. Written in Go.

readme.summary: Excellent high-level explanation of what Hydra is and why to use it, but lacks concrete quick-start examples and troubleshooting guidance in the README itself.
readme.top_issue: No inline quick-start code or configuration examples - users must navigate to external docs to see any actual usage

injection_risks.description: Potential panic on error, consider using proper error handling instead of panicking
Use of fmt.Printf with user-controlled input (e.g., version) may lead to potential format string vulnerabilities, consider using a safer alternative like log.Println
Potential panic on error, consider using proper error handling instead of panicking

critical_findings: Lack of proper error handling and potential panic on errors
Insufficient input validation for user-controlled input
security.summary: The codebase has some security concerns, including potential injection risks, insufficient input validation, and lack of proper error handling, but no critical secrets or sensitive information exposure was found.

common_complaints: Environmental/platform-specific bugs (Apple Silicon, time change CPU spike)
Missing OAuth standards support (RFC8693 Token Exchange pending since 2018)
praise_themes: Clear contribution guidelines followed by reporters
Professional issue templates with preflight checklists
sentiment.summary: Ory Hydra shows moderate community health with engaged contributors following proper procedures, but concerning abandonment signals include a 7+ year old feature request still pending (RFC8693) and recent bugs (Apple Silicon, configuration) with minimal engagement, suggesting maintainer capacity constraints.

red_flags: Some responses are dismissive of new contributors' efforts
There's a lack of clear communication regarding the process for contributing
communication.summary: The maintainers provide some useful information but could be more welcoming and clearer about contribution guidelines.

concerns: No commits in the past 6 months despite last commit being very recent (suggests data anomaly or stale repository)
113 open issues with no closed issues in past 6 months indicates issues are not being addressed
No merged PRs in past 6 months shows no active development or community contributions being integrated
No active contributors in past 6 months confirms lack of maintenance activity
Unknown last release date suggests release history is not being tracked or maintained
maintenance.summary: ory-hydra appears abandoned with a large backlog of unresolved issues and zero maintenance activity over the past 6 months, despite a recent commit timestamp that may indicate a data inconsistency.

changelog.summary: The changelog effectively marks breaking changes and categorizes updates, but lacks migration guides.

governance.summary: The documentation lacks details on succession, decision-making, and contributor paths but indicates multiple maintainers.

project_metrics.description: Internet-scale OpenID Certified™ OpenID Connect and OAuth2.1 provider that integrates with your user management through headless APIs. Solve OIDC/OAuth2 user cases over night. Consume as a service on Ory Network or self-host. Trusted by OpenAI and many others for scale and security. Written in Go.

analysis_summary.doc_summary: The README provides a good overview of the package's features and capabilities, but lacks clear installation instructions and troubleshooting guidance.
concerns: Docs: Lack of clear and concise installation instructions and quick start examples
Community: High CPU & RAM Usage on ARM32 and ARM64
Community: Unable to create client using DCR endpoint
Communication: Some responses are dismissive of new contributors' efforts
Communication: There's a lack of clear communication regarding the process for contributing
Security: Lack of proper error handling and potential panic on errors
Security: Insufficient input validation for user-controlled input
highlights: High number of commits in the past six months (268)
Recent open and closed issues and PRs indicate ongoing development
Multiple contributors active in the last six months
Breaking changes clearly marked in changelog
